mdRecord.dcterms:title: Receipt, for James (enslaved carpenter), 1757 February 15
mdRecord.dcterms:description: An early receipt regarding a slave at Mount Vernon, docketed by George Washington. The receipts reads "Colo. George Washington, for the Hire of Carpenter James [and] Cr. by 5 yds of Negroes Cotton." Carpenter James was likely a slave carpenter hired to work on the renovation of Mount Vernon. The reverse contains a partial notation by Charles Washington (1738-1799), youngest brother of George, dated 23 April 1759. Autograph document, 1 page.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
Slaves
